title: Consumer financial services professional
occupationalSummary: <p>This occupation is found in xxxxxxxx<br /><br />The broad purpose of the occupation is xxxxxxxxxxxx<br /><br />In their daily work, an employee in this occupation interacts with xxxxxxxxxxxx<br /><br />An employee in this occupation will be responsible for xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx</p>

knowledges.detail: The structure of the global financial services industry and the role of their sector and organisation.
The features and principles of professional standards and best practice in financial services, and how these are applied within retail, commercial and corporate contexts.

External factors and the wider landscape and its impact on financial service delivery in a retail, commercial and corporate context and how organisations mitigate negative impacts and optimise positive ones.
Internal organisational roles and structures within retail, commercial and corporate financial services.
The features and principles of the legal and regulatory frameworks and ethics in the Financial Services sector including xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
Risk and governance frameworks, how these impact on their role, how to facilitate compliance and the implications of non-compliance for their organisation.

The role green and sustainable policies and practices play in the finance sector and how to minimise negative impacts maximise positive impacts on environmental sustainability within the context of the role.
Approaches to identifying customer segments, their needs and service channels  relative to their role.
fair customer outcomes including regulatory principles and organisational standards and values
The principles of excellent customer service and relationship management.
The impact the organisational policies, procedures and objectives have on successful financial services delivery and how this is measured by key performance indicators.
Systems, tools and techniques used in the role such as project management techniques and IT tools together with the standards to be set.
The local business market they operate in including financial, economic and market awareness as well as demographics, and nature of the competition
The Range of retail banking products and services available to clients or customers.
The local business market they operate in including financial, economic and market awareness as well as demographics, and nature of the competition
Business dynamics, how businesses work and develop
The range of commercial and business banking products and services available to clients or customers

behaviours.detail: 1.	Honesty and integrity - truthful in their actions. Shows integrity by doing the right thing and demonstrating the organisationâ€™s values
2.	Maintains confidentiality and acts with due care and diligence.
3.	Resilient in challenging, changing environments and adapts positively to changing work priorities and patterns. Is flexible to the needs of the organisation
4.	Creative, innovative and enterprising when seeking solutions to business needs, whilst understanding relevant boundaries.
5.	Takes ownership for the quality of work, recognises and resolves errors and takes responsibility for decisions and procedures implemented
6.	Empathetic towards others and supports a diverse and inclusive culture

skills.detail: Builds and maintain working relationships with customers and stakeholders, contracting and managing stakeholder expectations.
Works with clients or customers to identify their relevant financial services requirements and identifies risks and opportunities for them.
Implement and maintain finance related administrative procedures and guidance that enables team delivery
Identifies and communicates risks to the relevant management or compliance personnel within the organisation, understanding and following the appropriate company process to address.
Match and use project management techniques applicable to the circumstances enabling delivery of projects or part of a project as required
Applies green and sustainable finance principles and practice in their roles
Contribute to the development of strategic and operational plans for their area
Report on progress and operational plans to stakeholders such as senior leaders and team.
Evaluate and analyse information from various sources to inform decisions when advising and recommending products
Take an evidence-based approach to decision making.
Deals effectively with stakeholders at every level of the organisation required by the role.

Communicates financial services concepts to colleagues, customers and other less technical stakeholders, selecting an appropriate communication method for the audience, for example verbal, written and presentations.
Identifies ways to become a better listener and is able to adapt their style to the recipient and situation
Builds working relationships with colleagues to achieve results
Leads others whether in a team or as part of a project to achieve desired outcomes
Identifies opportunities to drive higher performance for self and others and improve services or processes
Takes ownership of self-development and continuous improvement and supports others in their development
Handles data safely and securely and shares information in compliance with data protection legislation and organisationâ€™s policy
Keeps up to date with developments in Information Technology relative to their role
Support the business and customers through financial analysis and applying financial modelling and risk management tools
Supports the development or implementation of business development or customer contact strategies.

Applies financial analysis techniques relevant to the area of the bank, for example provide guidance on credit appetite, develop practical and appropriate credit solutions or lending structures or maximise portfolio return
Supports client or customer account planning and growth activities
Undertakes data or financial analysis planning and uses modelling tools that are required for the role.

englishAndMathsQualifications: <p>English and maths qualifications must be completed in line with the <a rel="noopener" href="https://www.gov.uk/guidance/apprenticeship-funding-rules" target="_blank">apprenticeship funding rules</a>.</p>
reviewDetails: this apprenticeship will be reviewed in accordance with our change request policy.
clusterDescription: Provide high quality advice and support to internal and external clients across a full range of financial instruments and services using specialist knowledge of instruments and services supported and areas of the business worked in

duties.dutyDetail: support delivery of financial services through digital banking solutions to clients both domestically and globally interacting with stakeholders in areas such as payments services, control, change, data, customer experience, and digital initiatives.
manage operational risks across the business and in compliance with applicable internal policies, and external laws and regulations at a global level.
deliver financial services activities within the regulatory framework, in which the organisation operates, and the regulatory requirements and expectations relevant to the role.
deliver financial services activities with the highest standards of ethics.
deliver against individual and team performance measures such as customer growth and active customers.
communicate complex financial information clearly and in appropriate formats to stakeholders to facilitate informed decision making on financial products and strategies.
work with stakeholders to develop and deliver initiatives at pace, whilst managing risk, and project requirements
contribute to identifying areas for improvement within the organisation and follow through until implementation.
promote green and sustainable finance products, principles and practice.
support others in their professional development by maintaining sectorial knowledge and sharing knowledge with peers.
support individual clients or customers with financial advice and the implementation of financial solutions either face to face or remotely.
handle non-routine customer queries, requests and complaints and act as an escalation point for front-line staff.
plan, launch and implement new products, services and processes for customers and clients
Support the business and clients or customers through financial analysis and applying financial modelling and risk management tools relative to a retail banking role such as xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
represent the organisation within the wider community and build local contacts to benefit the reputation of the business.
offer expert industry insight on corporate and commercial financial services to deliver appropriate solutions and maximise overall customer satisfaction.
assist corporate customers with carrying out financial services such as lending to cash and liquidity management across the globe.
address operational needs and day-to-day transactions of corporate and commercial customers such as supporting day to day banking through to complex corporate financing arrangements.
support with the development, management and delivery of transaction corporate and commercial banking solutions including account planning, commercials, client experience and risk management.
carry out financial analysis and apply modelling tools relative a commercial or business banking role such as .............................
structure, price, negotiate terms for new debt deals for existing and new clients and adhere to pricing policies for debt, credit balances and money transmission products

drive the sales and growth of customer portfolios through regular reviews, solution-based approach using market and industry information with the clients
IS THIS INVESTMENT BANKING?

manage a portfolio of customer relationships, maximising sustainable income and client profitability 
IS THIS INVESTMENT BANKING?

prepare and assess credit applications, manage operational, reputational and credit risk for the portfolio and adhere to risk service standards.
IS THIS INVESTMENT BANKING?

deliver market materials to clients, demonstrating deep sector and product expertise
IS THIS INVESTMENT BANKING?

ensure effective risk management and work with other stakeholders to carry out Enhanced Due Diligence reviews for your portfolio of clients
IS THIS INVESTMENT BANKING?

Deliver, monitor, and review solutions to clients based on corporate client investment profile.
IS THIS INVESTMENT BANKING?

Maintain personal accountability for the performance of own client book and generate healthy pipeline of target market prospects and convert them into clients..
IS THIS INVESTMENT BANKING?
Implement an asset allocation in line with the client needs, and model portfolios as benchmarks.
